heading: What exactly is Augmented Reality (AR)?
body: Augmented Reality (AR) overlays digital information, such as images, videos, and 3D models, onto the real world. Unlike virtual reality (VR), AR doesn't replace your view of the real world; it enhances it. Think of apps like Pokémon GO or Snapchat filters—they use AR to blend virtual content with your surroundings. heading: How does Virtual Reality (VR) differ from AR?
body: Virtual Reality (VR) completely immerses users in a simulated environment, often through a headset that blocks out the real world. It creates an entirely new, interactive digital world. Augmented reality, on the other hand, adds digital elements to the real world, allowing you to see and interact with both simultaneously.
